title: Torricellis theorem - im about height vs distance

content.question: Which of the following graphs represents the correct relationship between <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"> <mi>x</mi> </math> and <math alttext="h" overflow="scroll"> <mi>h</mi> </math>?

choices.label: The figure shows the graph of a curve in the first quadrant of a plane with the origin labeled O. The value h is indicated at the end of the horizontal axis and a vertical dashed line extends straight up from it. The value x is indicated at the top of the vertical axis and a horizontal dashed line extends to the right from it. The curve begins at the origin and curves to the right and up towards the meeting point of the dashed lines, and is concave upwards and to the left.

The figure shows the graph of a curve in the first quadrant of a plane with the origin labeled O. The value h is indicated at the end of the horizontal axis and a vertical dashed line extends straight up from it. The value x is indicated at the top of the vertical axis and a horizontal dashed line extends to the right from it. The curve begins at the origin and curves upwards and to the right to the meeting point of the dashed lines, and is concave downwards and to the right.

The figure shows the graph of a straight line in the first quadrant of a plane with the origin labeled O. The value h is indicated at the end of the horizontal axis and a vertical dashed line extends straight up from it. The value x is indicated at the top of the vertical axis and a horizontal dashed line extends to the right from it. The straight line begins at the origin and goes upwards and to the right to the meeting point of the dashed lines.

The figure shows the graph of a straight line in the first quadrant of a plane with the origin labeled O. The value h is indicated at the end of the horizontal axis and a vertical dashed line extends straight up from it. The value x is indicated at the top of the vertical axis and the straight line extends to the right from the coordinates (0,x) until the line meets the vertical dashed line at h.

content.answer: The figure shows the graph of a curve in the first quadrant of a plane with the origin labeled O. The value h is indicated at the end of the horizontal axis and a vertical dashed line extends straight up from it. The value x is indicated at the top of the vertical axis and a horizontal dashed line extends to the right from it. The curve begins at the origin and curves upwards and to the right to the meeting point of the dashed lines, and is concave downwards and to the right.

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
